item.value: Specifies a mutable bitmap for the canvas to draw into
The initial target density of the canvas is the same as the given bitmap's density.
Construct a canvas with the specified bitmap to draw into. The bitmap must be mutable.
以下操作是为了避免边缘出现一些 RenderScript 伪影。
The following manipulation is to avoid some RenderScript artifacts at the edge.

Manually render this view (and all of its children) to the given Canvas. The view must have already done a full layout before this function is called. When implementing a view, implement {@link onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas)} instead of overriding this method. If you do need to override this method, call the superclass version. @param canvas The Canvas to which the View is rendered.

Sets up this AnimatorSet to play all of the supplied animations at the same time. This is equivalent to calling {@link play(Animator)} with the first animator in the set and then {@link Builderwith(Animator)} with each of the other animators. Note that an Animator with a {@link AnimatorsetStartDelay(long) startDelay} will not actually start until that delay elapses, which means that if the first animator in the list supplied to this constructor has a startDelay, none of the other animators will start until that first animator's startDelay has elapsed. @param items The animations that will be started simultaneously.
Randomly pick a different start in the array of available images.
Demonstrates the use of the blurring view.
设置blur Script对象的输入内存
Fills the bitmap's pixels with the specified {@link Color}.
Use {@link setBlurredView(android.view.View)} to set up the reference to the view to be blurred.
A custom view for presenting a dynamically blurred version of another view's content.
NOTE: Do not place your application dependencies here; they belong in the individual module build.gradle files
Extension method to provide simpler access to
